reference.shortdesc: The revprop element in a DITAVAL document identifies a value of the rev attribute for flagging. Unlike the conditional processing attributes, which can be used for both filtering and flagging, the rev attribute can only be used for flagging.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Neither the reprop element or the rev attribute are designed to be used for version control.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: If no alternate text is specified, processors can provide default alternate text to indicate the start and end point of the flagged content.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: It is an error to include more than one revprop element with the same val attribute. Recovery from this error is implementation dependent. In such cases processors MAY provide an error or warning message.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element:

dd.p: Specifies the action to be taken. The following values are supported:

dlentry.dd: Indicates that the content is included in the output and flagged, if the content has not been excluded.
Indicates that the content is included in the output and not flagged. This is the default behavior, unless otherwise set.

Indicates that the content is included in the output and that the attribute value is preserved. This enables further processing by a runtime engine. The attribute value is preserved in the syntax that is required by the runtime engine.
Specifies the value of the rev attribute. If the val attribute is not specified, then the revprop element declares a default behavior for any instance of the rev attribute.

Specifies a color, style, or character to be used for rendering a change bar.
Do we want to be more specify about what values are supported here? Hex codes or names for color, character, but what for styles? Refer to XSL: FO spec?

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the revprop element can be used to flag content that has been marked with the rev attribute. Elements that specify rev="edits" are rendered in red text, and glyphs mark the start and end points of the flagged revision. Alternate text is provided.
example.codeblock: <val> <revprop action="flag" color="red" val="edits"> <startflag imageref="start-glyph.png> <alt-text>Start of revision</alt-text> </startflag> <endflag imageref="end-glyph.png> <alt-text>End of revision</alt-text> </endflag> </revprop> </val>
